common_issues.title: Pieces OS connectivity issues across plugins
common_issues.description: Users report various connectivity problems with Pieces OS across different plugins (VS Code, Chrome extension). Issues include empty settings windows, outdated plugin versions, and failure to establish connections. Some have attempted workarounds like custom URLs and Ngrok forwarding without success.  Check plugin compatibility with Pieces OS version, ensure the latest versions are installed, and verify network connectivity.

related_issues.title: WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
related_issues.text:
WSL cannot connect to Pieces OS in VS Code
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I tried to use Pieces extensions in VS Code for WSL:Ubuntu. Piesces Setting window is empty, but earlier it showed two buttons Launch and Install and when you click on Install, for example, VS Code shows notification that it can't connect to Pieces OS. I tried multiple fixes I found. One is to set Custom URL for Remote environment and I tried with <Windows IP>:1000 and with NGrok forwarding of same url, both without success and I could reach both with curl. There are some errors in VS Code Developer tools related to Pieces OS extension:

Uncaught (in promise) TypeError: version is longer than 256 characters
at new it (settingsView.js:1:5120)
at UH (settingsView.js:1:9927)
at Object.tU (settingsView.js:1:10530)
at vN (settingsView.js:19:354749)

at
https://vscode-remote+wsl-002bubuntu.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/home/vladan/.vscode-server/extensions/meshintelligenttechnologiesinc.pieces-vscode-2.0.6/dist/settingsView.js

and Pieces OS log shows error:

GET     [404] /assets/stream/identifiers: port:Instance of 'Future<int>': (2nd server)


Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
related_issues.text:
Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, JetBrains, VS Code, Visual Studio, Obsidian, JupyterLab, Sublime Plugin, Raycast Extension, Pieces CLI, Neovim

### Operating System / Platform

macOS/Windows/Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!

common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2 bugs: create memory, slow chat, image pasting
common_issues.description: Users report issues with Pieces OS 11.4.2, including failure to create memory pieces via MCP, slow or unresponsive chat, and inability to paste images.  These issues occur across desktop app, VS Code, and Visual Studio on Windows.  A fix for memory creation is expected in 11.4.3. Further investigation is needed for chat and image pasting issues.

The issue is that whenever copilot tries to use the create_memory_pieces tool it fails. common_issues.title: Pieces OS 11.4.2: Chat and image features not working
common_issues.description: Users report issues with chat functionality, including infinite loading, slow responses, and no response.  Image pasting results in errors.  This affects the desktop application on Windows, potentially related to GPT 4.1 integration.  Check Pieces OS and GPT 4.1 status, and ensure stable internet connection.

common_issues.title: LTM and Pieces Desktop App Issues on macOS
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces Desktop application on macOS, specifically related to LTM (Long-Term Memory).  LTM is turning off unexpectedly, requiring users to restart it. Additionally, Pieces Copilot is not correctly retrieving LTM information, displaying incorrect dates and generating unrelated content in chats.  One user reported the desktop app periodically jumping to the main monitor and grabbing focus. Reinstalling the app may resolve some of these issues.

related_issues.title: bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
related_issues.text:
bug: LTM continues to turn off, requiring me to turn LTM back on periodically
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M.

related_issues.title: Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
related_issues.text:
Pieces Copilot doesn't get the LTM info and shows a wrong date
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [ ] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

After I did all my work with LTM turned on, I used the `Start Copilot Chat` button in the **Workstream Activity** View of Pieces Desktop. I asked it to generate some quiz questions based on what I studied, and it started talking about a lot of unrelated topics, even when the context was provided. Though when I started a new chat based on the context again and became more specific with the details such as lecture name and number (that was the one and only thing in the context I started the conversation with), it did it correctly. Also, all this while, the context time showed Last Thursday so I think there is an UI bug too. 

**Context Image:**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ab732ff6-d195-4e81-a2af-6cee1e1d2032)

**Chat Image (Where it talks about unrelated topics):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d6abd44-60a0-4f0c-9f8a-1cf1a887fd2e)

**Chat Image (Where it was fixed):**
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c7d86c81-ba0e-4ec3-8e2f-49a326ac232a)

MacOS Desktop periodically jumps to main monitor & grabs focus off of current window
### Checked for Existing Issues?

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Just attempted reinstall, will see if that clears it up. Looks like it spawned an extra process which might be what's tripping it. So far it hasn't jumped back up, so we might be clear.

i grabbed a trace of the behavior, reach out on Pieces discord if u want a copy

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving connectivity issues between Pieces OS and its plugins (VS Code, Chrome extension) by checking compatibility, ensuring latest versions, and verifying network connectivity.
Investigate and address the bugs in Pieces OS 11.4.2 related to memory creation, slow chat responses, and image pasting. Monitor the fix for memory creation in 11.4.3.
Address the chat and image feature issues in Pieces OS 11.4.2, focusing on infinite loading, slow responses, and image pasting errors. Investigate potential connection with GPT 4.1 integration.
Resolve the LTM issues on macOS, including unexpected shutdowns and incorrect data retrieval by Pieces Copilot.  Also investigate the desktop app's focus grabbing behavior.
Improve communication about breaking changes and plugin updates, ensuring users are aware of necessary actions after Pieces OS updates (e.g., updating all plugins).
